bitfield.description: The start flag of the IPIPE module. When EN is 1, the IPIPE module starts a processing from the next rising edge of the VD. If the processing mode of the IPIPE module is ?one shot?, the EN is cleared to 0 immediately after the processing has started.
The mode selection of the ipipeif_wrt which is an input port of the IPIPE module. If WRT is 0, the IPIPE module doesn?t use the ipipeif_wrt. Else the IPIPE module uses it.
The processing mode selection of the IPIPE module. Value 0 indicates the mode of ?free run?, value 1 indicates the mode of ?one shot?.
Chroma sumpling postion in YUV422 to 444 This field is only valide if FMT=3 and FT2=2

bitenum.description: 422 to 444 upsampling is processed assuming, chroma pixels are sampled at the same position as Y signals.
422 to 444 upsampling is performed assuming chroma pixels are sampled at the center of two Y signals.

bitfield.description: YUV processing mode This field is valid only when FMT=3 (YUV input YUV output)

bitenum.description: Enhanced YUV mode is off. Only EdgeEnhancer, CAR, and CGS are enabled in YUV input
YUV422 input is upconverted to YUV444 422to444 is always used. GBCE, EdgeEnhancer, CAR, CGS, Histogram on YUV, BCS can be enabled.
YUV422 input is converted to full color RGB YUVtoRGB (RGBtoRGB1 is used), Gamma (as non linear table), RGB2RGB2, 3DLUT, GBCE are used. EdgeEnhancer, CAR, CGS, Histogram on YUV, BSC can be enabled.

bitfield.description: IPIPE module datapath selection

bitenum.description: IN: RAW BAYER OUT: YUV422 Note that the IPIPE YUV422 output goes to the RESIZER module where it can be further be converted in YUV420 or RGB format.
IN: RAW BAYER OUT: RAW BAYER The data are output after the White Balance module. It enables to bypass a large part of the IPIPE module.
IN: YUV422 OUT: YUV422 Note that the IPIPE YUV422 output goes to the RESIZER module where it can be further be converted in YUV420 or RGB format.
IN: RAW BAYER OUT: DISABLED The data are only going to BOXCAR and HISTOGRAM modules.

bitfield.description: The color pattern of the odd line and odd pixel. This parameter is valid when IPIPE_SRC[FMT] is 0,1,2.
The color pattern of the odd line and even pixel. This parameter is valid when IPIPE_SRC[FMT] is 0,1,2.
The color pattern of the even line and odd pixel. This parameter is valid when IPIPE_SRC[FMT] is 0,1,2.
The color pattern of the even line and even pixel. This parameter is valid when IPIPE_SRC[FMT] is 0,1,2.
The vertical position of the global frame from the rising edge of the VD. The IPIPE module will start an image processing from VAL line.
The vertical size of the processing area. The VAL0 can not be written. The IPIPE module will process (VAL+1) lines.
The horizontal position of the global frame from the rising edge of the HD. The IPIPE module will start an image processing from VAL clock.
The horizontal size of the processing area. The VAL0 is fixed. The IPIPE module processes (VAL+1) clocks.
This is the LSB of the VAL[12:0]. This bit is read only.
EDOF port selection

bitenum.description: Not used This value must be selected for OMAP4/5/6
Used Can not be selected for OMAP4/5/6

bitfield.description: Status of Histogram Process (busy status).
Status of Histogram bank select.
Status of BSC process (busy status).
Status of Boxcar process (busy status).

Status of Boxcar process (error status). This bit will be triggered when an overflow happens while transferring the boxcar data to memory. Instead of polling for this register, it is preferable to use the IPIPE_BOXCAR_OVF interrupt. Overflow errors are non receoverable at ISP5 level and require a software reset at ISS level.
The on/off selection of the clk_arm_g0 which is used for some ARM register access.
The on/off selection of the clk_pix_g3 which is use for the IPIPE processes of ?EE? and 'CAR'.
The on/off selection of the clk_pix_g2 which is use for the IPIPE processes of ?CFA? to '422', 'Histogram(YCbCr input)', and 'Boundary Signal Calculator'.
The on/off selection of the clk_pix_g1 which is used for the IPIPE processes of 'DefectCorrection' to 'WhiteBalance', and 'Histogram(RAW input)'.
The on/off selection of the clk_pix_g0 which is used for the IPIPE processing of 'Boxcar'.
Enable of LUT defect pixel correction.
LUT table type selection.
Replace dot selection on processing method 0.
The address of the first valid data in look-up-table
The number of valid data in look-up-table. (SIZ+1)

bitenum.description: Co-sited Bayer format Sets the CFA in co-sited Bayer format: the sampling points of R/Gr/Gb/B in each 2x2 block is at the same position. In this mode, the CFA interpolator simply copies R, G, and B to all points in the 2x2 block. (G is an average of Gb and Gr.)

register.description: YUV422 down sampling register. This register controls the YUV444 to YUV422 chroma downsampling. This register is valid if.FMT = 0 (RAW input and YUV output). = 0 leads to pure subsampling, no filtering, cosited chroma output. = 1 leads to (1, 1) 1 filtering, centered chroma output. = 2 leads to (1, 2, 1) 1 filtering, cosited chroma output. = 3 leads to (1, 3, 3, 1) 3 filtering, centered chroma output. When the chroma output is cosited, and that downsampling is enabled in the RESIZER module, one need to take care that the averager disrupts the relative phase for luma and chroma color components. The and registers need to be used to fix the disruption.

bitfield.description: 121-LPF enable for chrominance samples. This register is valid ifIPIPE_SRC_FMT.FMT = 0 (RAW input and YUV output).

This bit sets the output position of the chrominance sample with regards to the luma sample positions. One can choose between centered and cosited. This register is valid ifIPIPE_SRC_FMT.FMT = 0 (RAW input and YUV output). The RESIZER module does not change the relative position of the chroma samples vs. the luma samples between the input and output and the chroma position at the output of the IPIPE module and at the output of the RESIZER module shall be identical. In other words, we shall have RSZ_YUV_PHS.POS = IPIPE_YUV_PHS.POS.
Enable of GBCE module.
GBCE method selection

bitenum.description: Y value table Y out= LUT[Y in] Cb out = Cb in Cr out = Cr in
Gain table Y out= LUT[Y in] * Y in Cb out = LUT[Y in] * Cb in Cr out = LUT[Y in] * Cr in

bitfield.description: The on/off selection of the ?Edge enhancer?.

The on/off selection of the ?fault color suppression?. When the RSZ_SRC_FMT.FMT0='1' (Bayer input, Bayer output), this bit must be 0.

Note: This bit is added to OMAP5430 release and after. To specify the order of chroma in dynamic switching. This value should be zero unless Cb and Cr is flipped at RGBtoYCbCr/ 0: Normal Cb/Cr order (default) 1: Flipped order (Cr/Cb)

bitenum.description: Flipped chroma order (Cr/Cb). This value is used only when Cb and Cr are flipped in RGBtoYUV module.

bitfield.description: The mode selection of the ?fault color suppression?. To select median filter, set TYP=1 and IPIPE_CAR_SWT.SW0=255 (default values)
Threshold-2 for switching function (Select gain control)
Threshold-1 for switching function (Select median filter)

This bit enables ordisables the BOXCAR functionality. The BOXCAR output is written to SDRAM. One need to set theIPIPE_BOX_SDR_SAD_H and IPIPE_BOX_SDR_SAD_L registers with the appropriate address.
The processing mode selection of the Boxcar function. A 0 indicates the mode of the ?free run?, a 1 indicates the mode of the ?one shot'.
Block size in boxcar sampling
The down shift value applied to the boxcar compuation result. R out = SUM (Rij) SHF G out = (SUM (Gr ij)/2 + SUM (Gr ij)/2) SHF B out = SUM (Gij) SHF
The higher 11 bits of the first address of output in memory.
The lower 16 bits of the first address of output in memory.
Ensures 32-byte alignment.

This bit enables or disables the HISTOGRAM functionality. When enabled, the HISTOGRAM computation will start the processing from the next rising edge of the VD pulse. If the processing mode of the HISTOGRAM is ?one shot?, the enable bit will be cleared to 0 immediately after the processing has started.
The processing mode selection of the Histogram module. A 0 indicates the mode of the ?free run?, a 1 indicates the mode of the ?one shot'.
Input selection. When SEL0=0, RGBY are sampled from the output of the line buffer in noise filter-2. When SEL0=1, YCbCr are sampled at the output of RGB2YCbCr module. Y is sampled twice.
G selection in Bayer mode (SEL0=0)

Histogram memory clear. The histogram can be cleared before the start of operations. However, the clear takes 512 cycles and therfore: + if line size 512, the first line shall not be used for histogram computation. + if line size 512, ceil (512/line size) lines shall not be used for histogram computation. It's the programmer's responsibility to set the histogram computation area outside the 'clear' area.

This bit shall be used to select which memory is used to store the histogram data. By selecting alternatively one or the other bit, one can double buffer the histogram output buffer. The 4 KB memory can either be read by the CPU or a DMA request.

bitenum.description: Use Table 0 and 1 = 4 KBytes in the memory ISP5 map.
Use Table 2 and 3 = 4 KBytes in the memory ISP5 map.

bitfield.description: The start flag of the ?Boundary Signal Calculator?.
The processing mode selection of the BSC module.
Enable of column sampling.
Enable of row sampling
Selects the element to be summed. (Y, Cb or Cr )
The number of row sum vectors. value = ROWNUM + 1 Range: 1-4
The down shift value for row sum vectors. Range: 0-7
The vertical position of the first sampling pixel; the first row to be summed.
The height of the area covered by a row sum vector. Height of the region = (ROW_VNUM + 1)*(ROW_VSKIP+1).IPIPE_BSC_ROW_VNUM must be odd, LSB = 1.
The LSB must be odd.
The interval of the rows. Interval = ROWSKIPV + 1 Range: 1-32
The horizontal position of the first sampling pixel; the first pixel in a row to be summed.
The horizontal number of samples in the area covered by a row sum vector. Width of the region = (ROW_HNUM + 1)*(ROW_HSKIP+1).
The interval of the pixels in a row to be summed. Interval = ROWSKIPH + 1 Range: 1-32
The number of column sum vectors. number = COLNUM + 1 Range: 1-4
The down shift value for column sum vectors. Range: 0-7
The vertical position of the first sampling pixel; the first pixel in a column to be summed.
The vertical number of samples in the area covered by a column sum vector. Height of the region = (COL_VNUM + 1)*(COL_VSKIP+1).
The interval of the pixels in a column to be summed. Interval = COLSKIPV + 1 Range: 1-32
The horizontal position of the first sampling pixel; the first column to be summed.
The width of the area covered by a column sum vector. Width of the region = (COL_HNUM + 1)*(COL_HSKIP+1).IPIPE_BSC_COL_HNUM must be odd, LSB = 1.
The LSB must be odd
The interval of the columns. Interval = COL_HSKIP + 1 Range: 1-32

register.description: Offset value applied to Y input becore YUVtoRGB matrix. These values are only valid if IPIPE_FMT[FMT]=3 (YUV422 input) IPIPE_FMT[FMT2]=2 (RGB processing after YUVtoRGB conversion)

bitfield.description: Y offset value (s9) Usually zero.

register.description: Offset value applied to CB input becore YUVtoRGB matrix. These values are only valid if IPIPE_FMT[FMT]=3 (YUV422 input) IPIPE_FMT[FMT2]=2 (RGB processing after YUVtoRGB conversion)

bitfield.description: Cb offset value (s9) Usually -128

register.description: Offset value applied to CR input becore YUVtoRGB matrix. These values are only valid if IPIPE_FMT[FMT]=3 (YUV422 input) IPIPE_FMT[FMT2]=2 (RGB processing after YUVtoRGB conversion)

bitfield.description: Cr offset value (s9) Usually -128
